report_title: DVD, Game & Video Rental in the US
executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency.

The DVD, Game and Video Rental industry includes brick-and-mortar operators that primarily engage in renting DVDs, videos and video games. Through the end of 2023, demand for DVD, video and gaming rental services plummeted, as consumers have pivoted to video on demand (VOD) and streaming services, continuing a decade-long trend in this direction. While COVID-19 stay-at-home mandates led to a temporary spike in demand for home entertainment, revenue was still negatively affected because of contamination concerns, social-distancing measures and Hollywood slowing down, which limited the number of new titles that rental servicers could provide. These trends resulted in revenue plummeting 29.4% in 2020 alone. IBISWorld estimates that revenue is expected to collapse at a CAGR of 13.9% to an estimated $1.1 billion through the end of 2023, with a 7.2% plunge expected in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Damaging Effects of COVID-19 Considerably Impact Consumer Behavior
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Since DVD, game and video rental services operate as brick-and-mortar services, the pandemic's effects on consumer activity dampened demand for video rental services and shifted consumer habits.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Expansion of Online Streaming Services Continues to Pummel Rental Service Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The largest contributor to the current plummeting of demand and revenue for video rental services continues to be the wide-scale adoption of online streaming services, such as Hulu and Netflix.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consistently High Cost of Operations Damage Growth Capability
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Since video rental service operate exclusively within traditional brick-and-mortar settings, the high cost of in-person business dampened growth prospects through the end of 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Heightened Competition From Cable Companies Pushes Consumers Away From Traditional Video Rental
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Even as video streaming services such as Netflix and Hulu continue to dominate the market and damage traditional DVD and video rental services, the implementation of similar infrastructure by cable companies adds to this trend.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Adoption Of Video Streaming Services From Consumers Poised To Damage Long-Term Prospects
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As consumers continue to favor video streaming services due to their ease of access and lower costs, traditional DVD, Game and Video rental services are poised to take a continued revenue hit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Economic Recovery Offers Some Respite for Video Rental Servicers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As economic conditions improve following COVID-19, consumer sentiment is poised to rebound, which bodes well for video rental servicers. A notable rebound in consumer spending, coupled with recovery in the Consumer Confidence Index, is set to fuel newfound interest in discretionary services such as DVD and video rentals.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Cost-Cutting Measures Set to Provide Some Long-Term Respite
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The implementation of improved customer service and acquisition of localized media content may provide smaller servicers with a lifeline that can offset larger losses.

industry_definition: Video rental servicers rent videos and discs containing movies, shows or games. On-demand and internet-streamed rentals are not included.
key_trends: Meeting demand for a diverse customer base enhances internal competition.
Accelerated adoption of online streaming services maintains strong external competition.
Accelerated adoption of online streaming services damages core revenue streams.

The high cost of business impacts growth prospects. Smaller video rental servicers that run a tight margin face a gloomy outlook because of lower consumer interest and consistent costs accrued toward operation of in-person kiosks.
Two companies own more than a 5.0% share of the market.
Visibility among large swath of consumers strengthens position within the market.
Consistent growth of demand from streaming services harms growth potential.
Light regulatory landscape boosts opportunities for new entrants.
High rate of adoption of streaming services dampens profitability.
Consistent demand for employees exacerbates wage costs.
High population density benefits establishments' presence.
Strong entertainment presence tied with notable establishment growth
Economic conditions influence rate of subscription among customers
Strong desire for physical movie rentals strengthens appeal among middle-aged customers

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 18 and 24. Heightened interest toward streaming services dampen demand among this age group.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 25 to 39. Since consumers within this age bracket are likelier to have families and kids, there is a diversified need for physical copies of DVDs and movies to rent films for themselves and their children.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers between the ages of 40 to 59. DVD, movie and game rentals are broadly popular with middle-aged consumers that have a steady income stream, can afford rentals either on a subscription or non-subscription model and have families with varied entertainment interests.

This market segment generates revenue among consumers aged 60 and older. Many older consumers lack the propensity to switch to online streaming services, either because of cost-related reasons or lack of technological access.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue from the rental of tapes, discs, video games and prerecorded cassettes without a subscription. As the largest generator of revenue for video rental servicers, non-subscription services enable customers to rent on a one-off or infrequent basis, making it a consistent revenue generator.

This product segment generates revenue from the rental of tapes, discs, video games and prerecorded cassettes via a subscription-based model. The accelerated adoption of online streaming services by consumers caused this segment to contract significantly, with virtual subscription options making it easier and more cost-efficient for the average consumer.

This product segment generates revenue from the outright sale of physical DVDs, games and movies. Since the appeal for physical DVDs and video games has dampened in recent years in light of a digitization push among consumers, this segment generates little revenue and has remained stagnant through the end of 2023.

tier_1_suppliers: Movie & Video Distribution in the US
Video Game Software Publishing in the US
Consumer Electronics Stores in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Semiconductor Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Circuit Board & Electronic Component Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Video streaming services have grown tremendously in popularity. Consumers will likely continue to use online services for media they previously sought through video rental services. The increased adoption of internet services reduces demand for video rental services, which does not include online streaming services. The percentage of services conducted online is expected to spike 10.5% in 2023.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Time Spent on Leisure and Sports
demand_determinants.determinant_description: People with increased leisure time have higher propensity to rent movies, TV shows and video games from video rental servicers. As unemployment gradually falls, people will be less likely to rent physical media and more likely to opt for less time-consuming rental options, such as streaming services.

Demand from video streaming services relates to companies that provide infrastructure to customers to watch videos via the internet. Revenue comes from paid subscriptions, video-on-demand transactions and paid advertising. Due to the increased reliance on digital technology and lifestyle changes caused by the coronavirus pandemic, demand from video streaming services is forecast to spike 8.5% in 2023.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes has many similarities with the Southeast, as it also has a sizable population presence and a diverse customer base of different ages that are in need of video rental services. In states like Illinois, establishments also benefit from consistent demand for movies and gaming, creating a lucrative market opportunity.

The appeal of video rental services is tied to large populations that provide a diverse customer base, making the Southeast a prime target for establishment growth. In states like Florida, large metropolitan centers and sprawling suburbs provide a diverse customer base of various ages that are in-demand for video rental services.

Some of the other regions that have a significantly smaller share of establishments include the Plains, the Rocky Mountains and the New England regions. These areas lack large population centers and broader appeal for physical movie and DVD rentals, with unfavorable geography adding incentive for consumers within these regions to go digital when streaming movies.

Many entertainment companies and customers reside in the Mid-Atlantic, making it a prime target for establishment growth. In states like New York, a booming population presence further adds incentive for establishments to set up shop.

Although the Southwest lacks the population density other regions have, it continues to remain a lucrative option due to a steadily growing suburban environment that consists of a core market base. In states like Texas, many entertainment companies also operate in this area, further heightening demand for DVD and movie rentals among a large swath of customers.

Some of the other regions that have a significantly smaller share of establishments include the Plains, the Rocky Mountains and the New England regions. These areas lack large population centers and broader appeal for physical movie and DVD rentals, with unfavorable geography adding incentive for consumers within these regions to go digital when streaming movies.

Some of the other regions that have a significantly smaller share of establishments include the Plains, the Rocky Mountains and the New England regions. These areas lack large population centers and broader appeal for physical movie and DVD rentals, with unfavorable geography adding incentive for consumers within these regions to go digital when streaming movies.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Video rental servicers are subject to federal copyright provisions on the copying, rental and sale of physical media as set forth in the US Copyright Act.
Widespread stay-at-home orders amid COVID-19 boosted demand for safe at-home entertainment, dampening demand for traditional video rental services in 2020.

basis_points.basis_title: Meeting demand for diverse customer base
basis_points.basis_description: Video rental servicers that maintain a diverse library of DVDs, games and videos will have a competitive edge and can capture a larger swath of customers.

basis_points.basis_title: Accelerated adoption of online streaming services
basis_points.basis_description: Consumers' accelerated rate of adoption of popular online streaming platforms creates a sizable competitive shift toward online providers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Consistent operating costs encourage broader consolidation for larger video rental servicers
concentration_points.concentration_description: Since video rental servicers deal with continued pressure from online streaming services and the digitization of entertainment content, larger servicers with strong capital positions are encouraged to expand their market share.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Impact of branding strengthens expanding servicers with strong marketability
concentration_points.concentration_description: A core determinant that influences expansion within the markets is the size and marketability of a video rental servicer, with more prominent servicers being naturally recognized by the average consumer.

cost_structure_breakdown.cost_type: Other expenses (insurance, distribution, technological maintenance, administrative)

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: High Cost of Maintenance Strengthens Administrative Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The largest expense for video rental servicers continues to be miscellaneous costs, such as insurance, distribution, technological maintenance and administrative expenses.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Consistent Trend of Managing Kiosks Maintains Steady Wage Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Since video rental servicers operate exclusively as in-person, brick-and-mortar entities, they require a consistent stream of employees and salespeople at the facilities for proper operations.
Some of the responsibilities employees have include stock ordering, stocking displays and customer service, making wage costs a core expenditure for the average video rental servicer.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Continued Need for Buildings to House Distribution Centers and Kiosks Maintains Rental Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: A core expenditure for video rental servicers continues to be the cost of renting a commercial space to house distribution centers and self-service kiosks.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Although labor is a crucial factor for new entrants, there are considerably higher capital costs accrued by the average video rental servicer. The procurement of products, coupled with payments for commercial rent, establishes large capital intensity for a new entrant.

volatility_points.volatility_title: DVD, Game and Video Rental Servicers Endure Moderate Revenue Volatility, with Heightened Online Competition Influential
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since consumers continue to adopt online streaming services as their primary form of digital entertainment, DVD, game and video rental servicers continue to endure steadily growing revenue volatility.

volatility_points.volatility_title: High Operating Costs Adds to Uncertainty, Particularly Among Smaller Servicers
volatility_points.volatility_description: As rental servicers continue to accrue consistent operating costs, such as rent and wages, the contraction of steady consumer interest has added uncertainty to revenue stability.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Continued Adoption of Computers Improves Customer Service
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: To improve customer service and efficiency in managing a large quantity of rentals, many video rental servicers have adopted computers as a way to organize rental due dates and communicate with customers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Boost in Video Quality Improves Viewing Quality
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Many of the traditional formats that video games and movies were sold under have been upgraded to adhere to newer technology in TVs and video players.

FAQs.question: What are the key points about the First Sale Doctrine?
FAQs.answer: Under the First Sale Doctrine, the owner of a lawfully made copy is granted distribution rights for copyrighted products by rental, lease, loan or resale. Unless authorized by the copyright holder via a reproduction license, owners of legal copies are not permitted to digitize the content.

FAQs.question: How did the COVID-19 pandemic impact the video rental industry?
FAQs.answer: Widespread stay-at-home orders amid COVID-19 boosted demand for safe at-home entertainment, dampening demand for traditional video rental services in 2020. Companies educated staff on CDC cleaning protocols when stocking kiosks or mailing DVDs and outlined methods for consumers to disinfect discs.

FAQs.question: What assistance does the Entertainment Merchants Association provide to video rental companies?
FAQs.answer: The EMA assists members by conducting market research, monitoring consumer trends, hosting industry events, and organizing government advocacy positions and actions. It also facilitates agreements with movie distributors regarding rental of certain titles.

FAQs.question: What is Redbox's market strategy?
FAQs.answer: Redbox specializes in movie and DVD rentals, focusing on providing the newest release films through its kiosks that stock up to 200 titles each. It remains one of the lowest cost entertainment options compared to competitors like Amazon and iTunes rentals.

FAQs.question: How does Redbox benefit from population density?
FAQs.answer: Redbox kiosks located in densely populated areas typically generate higher revenue from more rentals due to higher traffic and exposure.

FAQs.question: How has Redbox expanded its reach and reduced costs?
FAQs.answer: Redbox acquired its major competitor NCR Corporation in 2012 to expand reach and market share. It has also shifted towards automated kiosks to save on labor costs.

FAQs.question: What are Redbox's strategies for maintaining service while reducing costs?
FAQs.answer: To provide superior service and improve efficiency, Redbox has relocated kiosks to higher demand areas to minimize costs. It also operates a customer service line.

FAQs.question: How does Redbox finance capital expenditures?
FAQs.answer: Redbox's largest capital expenditures are for its automated rental kiosks, which must be purchased, removed and relocated periodically. The company also invests in R&D for the kiosks and software.

FAQs.question: How important are supply contracts for the video rental industry?
FAQs.answer: Having movie supply contracts in place ensures prompt product delivery to consumers and maintains a steady stream of products, decreasing consumer wait times.

FAQs.question: How do video rental companies manage consumer debts from late returns?
FAQs.answer: Companies must be able to manage debt accumulated from people who do not return rented products on time, which may be done through issuing late fees. Higher late fees can incentivize on-time returns.

FAQs.question: What are the benefits of operating from high-profile business locations?
FAQs.answer: Working from high-profile sites with easy access, ample parking, and extended hours gives companies a competitive advantage by ensuring the broadest customer stream and increasing brand exposure.

FAQs.question: How has competition from video on-demand services impacted the industry?
FAQs.answer: The growth of video streaming services has reduced demand for physical video rental services that do not include online streaming options, as consumers look online for convenient rental options.

FAQs.question: How does consumer spending impact the video rental industry?
FAQs.answer: Strengthening consumer spending makes consumers more open to discretionary entertainment spending like DVD, game and video rentals.
